input_text:
Job Title: Project Manager, Engineering (Onsite)

Location: Irvine, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Company Description

AbbVie’s purpose is profound, and our path is clear. We embrace the responsibility of making a remarkable impact on people's lives through the innovative medicines and solutions we create together. This is driven by our compassion for people, commitment to innovation and inclusion, service to the community, and uncompromising integrity at the heart of everything we do.

Operating as one AbbVie team, we care deeply for our patients, their families, our employees, and our communities. We strive to always do the right thing, pursuing the highest standards in quality, compliance, safety, and performance. In everything we do, we invest and innovate relentlessly to tackle unmet needs, creating new medicines and healthcare approaches for a healthier world.

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Job Description

Responsibilities for this exciting opportunity include, but are not limited to:

Responsible for compliance with applicable policies and procedures, as well as both internal and local codes. Ensures quality and effectiveness of key results of major cross-functional projects through sound design, early risk assessments, pre-engineering, solid budgetary planning, and implementation of fallback strategies.Develops, plans, coordinates, and directs the engineering aspects of construction projects with specific scopes and requirements. Manages multiple concurrent projects related to facilities and utilities for diverse sites.When developing a project scope, gather business needs and thoroughly understand the customer and business objective. Then, lead the development of said scope and Project Charter and document all requirements that satisfy the stakeholders' needs and expectations.Incorporates business foresight of emerging technological trends.Uses established PM tools and techniques (FEP, Cash Flow Projections, Scope / Schedule Control, etc.) to stay within authorized budget limits and achieve the overall project and organizational objectives to time, cost, and quality.Contributes to developing project management best practices and is extremely EHS cognizant.Defines roles and responsibilities. Monitors and controls project work to meet the performance objectives defined in the project plan.With good judgment, review change requests and manage and approve changes to the deliverables, organizational process assets, project documents, and project plan. Closes the project by finalizing all activities across all the Project Management Process Groups to formally complete the project or phase. Ensures the project design complies with all engineering standards, project objectives, and customer needs.Creates or coordinates the solutions for complex problems; integrates regulatory and operational needs; performs cost/benefit analysis. Explores multiple alternatives. I seek input from cross-functional teams to resolve major project hurdles. Resolves problems and crisis situations requiring fast, astute decision-making with rapid implementation. Mentors others by sharing knowledge and expertise and willingness to provide guidance with an All for One attitude. Establish relationships and good communication channels with customers; document agreements and commitments. Acts as a trusted partner. Ability to travel within State and/or Nationally, depending on business needs and strategy. Travel expected frequency 25%

The individual should embody the AbbVie way of working through thoughtful communication and a sense of urgency whilst maintaining compassion, respect for one another, and an All for One AbbVie attitude. Exercises good ethical judgment at all times. They should be passionate about improving the quality of life of our patients worldwide and understand that this, and every role in AbbVie, does just that.

Qualifications

A Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, science, or a related discipline is desired, or equivalent technical experience plus demonstrated competence, with a desired 8+ years of significant engineering and/or operational experience. A postgraduate education/degree is preferred and may contribute towards the desired years of experience.Experience with site construction and utilities in the manufacturing/pharma space. Possesses solid technical knowledge and application of concepts, practices, and procedures. Works on problems of complex scope where analysis of situations or data involves multiple competing factors. Exercises judgment and advises management as to the appropriate actions.Interacts well with diverse groups within engineering and maintains strong working relationships with internal and external collaborators.Listens to and understands others' points of view and articulates tactfully and respectfully one's perspective orally, in writing, and in presentations.Works well with other engineers in a collaborative, fast-paced, goal-driven environment.Possesses interpersonal skills to negotiate and reconcile differences.Has a technical background in health care, medical devices, pharmaceuticals, biologics, or similar industries (preferred).Has demonstrated competency in financial systems and fiscal control.Formal Project Management training (preferred)

Key Stakeholders:

Engineering ManagementOperations ManagementEH&S ManagementR&D ManagementTask Force SponsorsSenior Management

Additional Information

Applicable only to applicants applying to a position in any location with pay disclosure requirements under state or local law:

The compensation range described below is the range of possible base pay compensation that the Company believes in good faith it will pay for this role at the time of this posting based on the job grade for this position. Individual compensation paid within this range will depend on many factors including geographic location, and we may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range. This range may be modified in the future. We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off (vacation, holidays, sick), medical/dental/vision insurance and 401(k) to eligible employees. This job is eligible to participate in our short-term incentive programs. This job is eligible to participate in our long-term incentive programs 

Note: No amount of pay is considered to be wages or compensation until such amount is earned, vested, and determinable. The amount and availability of any bonus, commission, incentive, benefits, or any other form of compensation and benefits that are allocable to a particular employee remains in the Company's sole and absolute discretion unless and until paid and may be modified at the Company’s sole and absolute discretion, consistent with applicable law.

AbbVie is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
